snippet: Mercer University is undertaking a $5.6 million project, which partners student work with news organizations in the area, in the hopes of reviving local journalism.
abstract: Mercer University in Macon, Ga, is undertaking an ambitious $5.6 million project, which partners student work with the Macon newspaper and a Georgia Public Radio station, in hopes of reviving local journalism; reporters and editors for The Telegraph and the radio station will work out of the campus's new journalism center, alongside students.
lead_paragraph: Mercer University is undertaking a $5.6 million project, which partners student work with news organizations in the area, in the hopes of reviving local journalism.

headline.seo: In an Experiment, Students and Reporters Collaborate on Local News
headline.main: On Campus, an Experiment to Save Local News
